tpObject_list.tpObject: 43,574,454,0,It is likely that the Central Valley salamanders were all descended from a common ancestor.
534,571,444,0,Despite the difficulties found in species classificatio, there is a need for it in science.
44,649,454,0,Although scientists may have a need to place animals into classes. nature is not always so easily categorized.
534,650,425,0,The Central Valley salamander and other "ring species" illustrate the difficulties in classifying animals.
43,728,466,0,Any two animals that can breed with each other are considered members of the same species.
534,729,434,0,One solution to the problem involves placing animals into subspecies, but this approach results in problems of its own.
